tasks.task: Farmer preparing for profitable crop selection
subtasks: Researching profitable crops for small-scale farming
Understanding profit calculation in agriculture
Selecting bean variety (new beans, low-stopper beans, or waizimu)
Calculating seed quantity (e.g., 2.5 kg per nacre)
Estimating cost of production materials (e.g., 500 shillings for chemicals)
Planting beans in controlled nacre area
Monitoring bean growth and maintaining plants
Harvesting mature beans (1.5 bars at 90 kg each)
Selling harvested beans at market (e.g., 80 shillings per kg)
Selecting suitable planting time and location
Calculating seed quantity (2 kg per nacre)
Applying required inputs (pesticides and fertilizers)
Monitoring plant growth and preventing pests
Harvesting peas (200 kg per crop)
Selling harvested peas at market (e.g., 40 shillings per kg)
Choosing an appropriate variety (e.g., fast-growing)
Planting coriander in a nacre bed
Watering and weeding regularly
Harvesting coriander within 40 days
Selling coriander at market (e.g., 40 shillings per kg)
Replicating the cropping cycle for continuous income
Selecting high-demand maize variety
Planting maize seedlings in a nacre plot
Applying minimal fertilizers and pesticides
Monitoring for pests and diseases
Harvesting maize at maturity
Selling green or dried maize at market (e.g., 5 or 2,000 shillings per kg)
Obtaining seeds for selected indigenous vegetables
Preparing the planting area with minimal inputs
Planting the seeds and maintaining the crop
Harvesting over an extended period
Marketing to local grocery stores or neighbors
Establishing a consistent supply to maintain customer relationships
